column4: Hey guys. Can anyone tell me what package I need to install to get   /usr/lib/libc.a     ?
well you say very fantastic. It seems to have lied
Not finding /usr/lib/libc.a and I've just installed libc6-dev
but libc.a is a static library? i suppose you are rather looking for an so file?
well it told me I'm missing /usr/lib/libc.a
what on earth is that project? it does use some weird build makefile, that runs apt-get and some weird shell skripts????
Uses lots and lots of shell scripts. Doesn't apt-get though
where do you want to deploy that thing? it does probably query the apt database for various build tools (i.e. build-essential etc.)
installed that. It's basically a vastly slimmed down XBMC Live. Boots on my htpc in about 13/14 secs from cold

if it's already deployed why do you want to compile it again? do you know what command does query libc.a ? (does it exist on your computer that file in particular?) and why the hell does it link libc.a statically instead of building it's own version of libc ????

using the system libc to compile a binary for another kernel is a _very_ bad idea. i guess you need to adapt the build system and you defo should be able to install libc.a its either in libc6-dev or in libc6
why should clone fail? you may be on the wrong branch?
shouldn't be. On the one I'cve always been
